content.text: Let me also do a quick build check to make sure nothing is broken.

TypeScript compiles cleanly. Here's a summary of the changes on branch `feat/cmd-click-new-tab-create-session`:

**1. `web/src/App.tsx`** — Added a `useEffect` that checks for `?action=create` in the URL on page load. If present, it auto-opens the `CreateSessionDialog` and removes the parameter from the URL to prevent re-triggering on refresh.

**2. `web/src/features/sessions/sessions.tsx`** — Updated the sidebar "+" button:
- `onClick` now checks for `metaKey` (Mac) / `ctrlKey` (non-Mac). With modifier key, opens a new tab with `?action=create`; without, keeps original behavior.
- Tooltip now shows a second line: `{Cmd|Ctrl}+Click open in new tab`.

**3. `web/src/features/chat/components/chat-conversation.tsx`** — Same Cmd+Click logic and tooltip update applied to the empty state "Create new session" button.

N/A

## Description

Support Cmd+Click (Mac) / Ctrl+Click (Windows/Linux) on all "+" new-session buttons to open the create-session flow in a new browser tab.

**Changes:**

- **`web/src/App.tsx`**: Detect `?action=create` and `?action=create-in-dir&workDir=xxx` URL params on page load to auto-open the create dialog or directly create a session in the specified directory. Params are consumed after use to prevent re-triggering on refresh.
- **`web/src/features/sessions/sessions.tsx`**: Top-level "+" button and grouped-view "New session here" button both support Cmd+Click to open a new tab. Tooltips updated with modifier-key hint.
- **`web/src/features/chat/components/chat-conversation.tsx`**: Empty-state "Create new session" button supports Cmd+Click to open a new tab. Tooltip updated with modifier-key hint.

## Checklist

- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/MoonshotAI/kimi-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) document.
- [x] I have linked the related issue, if any.
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.
- [x] I have run `make gen-changelog` to update the changelog.
- [x] I have run `make gen-docs` to update the user documentation.
EOF
)"
